# Question

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

Here is a Julia implementation:

```julia
function timezone_bumper(dt::DateTime; bump=3)
    if typeof(dt) === Date
        throw(ArgumentError("Provided type must be DateTime, not Date"))
    end
    Δ = Hour(bump)
    return dt + Δ
end
```
This function takes a `DateTime` as input and returns the same date-time with an additional offset equal to the bump hours. If a `Date` is provided instead of a `DateTime`, it will throw an error.
